010package imagingbook.pub.regions.segment;
011
012import static imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D.N4;
013
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.Arrays;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import ij.IJ;
019import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
020import imagingbook.lib.tuples.Tuple2;
021import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
022import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
023import imagingbook.pub.regions.BinaryRegion;
024import imagingbook.pub.regions.Contour;
025import imagingbook.pub.regions.ContourTracer;
026
027/**
028 * Binary region segmenter based on a combined region labeling
029 * and contour tracing algorithm:
030 * F. Chang, C. J. Chen, and C. J. Lu. A linear-time component labeling
031 * algorithm using contour tracing technique. Computer Vision, Graphics,
032 * and Image Processing: Image Understanding 93(2), 206-220 (2004).
033 * Detected regions are 8-connected. 
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2020/04/01
037 */
038public class RegionContourSegmentation extends BinaryRegionSegmentation implements ContourTracer { 
039        
040        static private final int VISITED = -1;
041        
042        private List<Contour.Outer> outerContours;
043        private List<Contour.Inner> innerContours;
044        
045        /**
046         * Constructor. Creates a combined region and contour segmenter.
047         * @param ip A binary image with 0 values for background pixels and values &gt; 0
048         * for foreground pixels.
049         */
050        public RegionContourSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip) {
051                this(ip, DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD);
052        }
053        
054        public RegionContourSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType2D nh) {
055                super(ip, nh);
056                attachOuterContours();  // attach the outer contour to the corresponding region
057                attachInnerContours();  // attach all inner contours to the corresponding region
058        }
059        
060        // public methods required by interface ContourTracer (others are in inherited from super-class):
061        
062        @Override
063        public List<Contour.Outer> getOuterContours() {
064                return getOuterContours(false);
065        }
066        
067        @Override
068        public List<Contour.Outer> getOuterContours(boolean sort) {
069                Contour.Outer[] oca = outerContours.toArray(new Contour.Outer[0]);
070                if (sort) {
071                        Arrays.sort(oca);
072                }
073                return Arrays.asList(oca);
074        }
075        
076        @Override
077        public List<Contour.Inner> getInnerContours() {
078                return getInnerContours(false);
079        }
080        
081        @Override
082        public List<Contour.Inner> getInnerContours(boolean sort) {
083                Contour.Inner[] ica = innerContours.toArray(new Contour.Inner[0]);
084                if (sort) {
085                        Arrays.sort(ica);
086                }
087                return Arrays.asList(ica);
088        }
089        
090        // non-public methods ------------------------------------------------------------------
091        
092        @Override
093        protected int[][] makeLabelArray() {
094                // Create a label array which is "padded" by 1 pixel, i.e., 
095                // 2 rows and 2 columns larger than the image:
096                int[][] lA = new int[width+2][height+2];        // label array, initialized to zero
097                outerContours = new ArrayList<>();
098                innerContours = new ArrayList<>();
099                return lA;
100        }
101        
102        @Override
103        protected boolean applySegmentation() {
104                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {      // scan top to bottom, left to right
105                        int label = 0;  // reset label, scan through horiz. line:
106                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
107                                if (ip.getPixel(u, v) > 0) {    // hit an unlabeled FOREGROUND pixel
108                                        if (label != 0) { // keep using the same label
109                                                setLabel(u, v, label);
110                                        }
111                                        else {  // label == 0
112                                                label = getLabel(u, v);
113                                                if (label == 0) {       // new (unlabeled) region is hit
114                                                        label = getNextLabel(); // assign a new region label
115                                                        PntInt xs = PntInt.from(u, v);
116                                                        int ds = 0;
117                                                        Contour.Outer c = traceContour(xs, ds, new Contour.Outer(label));
118                                                        outerContours.add(c);
119                                                        setLabel(u, v, label);
120                                                }
121                                        }
122                                } 
123                                else {  // hit a BACKGROUND pixel
124                                        if (label != 0) { // exiting a region
125                                                if (getLabel(u, v) == BACKGROUND) { // unlabeled - new inner contour
126                                                        PntInt xs = PntInt.from(u - 1, v);
127                                                        int ds = (NT == N4) ? 2 : 1;
128                                                        Contour.Inner c = traceContour(xs, ds, new Contour.Inner(label));
129                                                        innerContours.add(c);
130                                                }
131                                                label = 0;
132                                        }
133                                }
134                        }
135                }
136                return true;
137        }
138        
139        // Trace one contour starting at Xs in direction ds     
140        private <T extends Contour> T traceContour(PntInt xs, final int ds, T C) {
141                final int label = C.getLabel(); // C: empty inner or outer contour              
142                
143                Tuple2<PntInt, Integer> next = findNextContourPoint(xs, ds);
144                PntInt x = next.get0();
145                int d = next.get1();    
146                C.addPoint(x);
147                
148                final PntInt xt = x;
149                boolean home = xs.equals(xt);
150                
151                while (!home) {
152                        setLabel(x, label);
153                        PntInt xp = x;
154                        int dn = (d + 6) % 8;
155                        next = findNextContourPoint(x, dn);
156                        x = next.get0();
157                        d = next.get1();
158                        // are we back at the starting position?
159                        home = (xp.equals(xs) && x.equals(xt)); // back at start pos.
160                        if (!home) {
161                                C.addPoint(x);
162                        }
163                }
164                return C;
165        }
166        
167        private static final int[][] delta = {
168                        { 1,0}, { 1, 1}, {0, 1}, {-1, 1}, 
169                        {-1,0}, {-1,-1}, {0,-1}, { 1,-1}};
170
171        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
172        
173        // Starts at point X0 in direction d0, returns a tuple holding
174        // the next point and the direction in which it was found if successful.
175        // Returns null if no successor point is found.
176        private Tuple2<PntInt, Integer> findNextContourPoint(final PntInt x0, final int d0) {
177                final int step = (NT == N4) ? 2 : 1;
178                PntInt x = null;
179                int d = d0;
180                int i = 0;
181                boolean done = false;
182                while (i < 7 && !done) {        // N4: i = 0,2,4,6  N8: i = 0,1,2,3,4,5,6
183                        x = x0.plus(delta[d][0], delta[d][1]);
184                        if (ip.getPixel(x.x, x.y) == BACKGROUND) {
185                                setLabel(x, VISITED);   // mark this background pixel not to be visited again
186                                d = (d + step) % 8;
187                        } 
188                        else {  // found a non-background pixel (next pixel to follow)
189                                done = true;
190                        }
191                        i = i + step;
192                }
193                return (done) ? 
194                                Tuple2.from(x, d) : 
195                                Tuple2.from(x0, d0);    // no successor found
196        }
197        
198        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
199        
200        private void attachOuterContours() {
201                for (Contour.Outer c : outerContours) {
202                        int label = c.getLabel();
203                        BinaryRegion reg = getRegion(label);
204                        if (reg == null) {
205                                IJ.log("Error: Could not associate outer contour with label " + label);
206                        }
207                        else {
208                                reg.setOuterContour(c);
209                        }
210                }
211        }
212        
213        private void attachInnerContours() {
214                for (Contour.Inner c : innerContours) {
215                        int label = c.getLabel();
216                        SegmentationBackedRegion reg = getRegion(label);
217                        if (reg == null) {
218                                IJ.log("Error: Could not associate inner contour with label " + label);
219                        }
220                        else {
221                                reg.addInnerContour(c);
222                        }
223                }
224        }
225
226        // access methods to the label array (which is padded!)
227        @Override
228        public int getLabel(int u, int v) {     // (u,v) are image coordinates
229                if (u >= -1 && u <= width && v >= -1 && v <= height)
230                        return labelArray[u + 1][v + 1];        // label array is padded (offset = 1)
231                else
232                        return BACKGROUND;
233                //return labelArray[u + 1][v + 1];      // original version
234        }
235        
236        @Override
237        protected void setLabel(int u, int v, int label) { // (u,v) are image coordinates
238                if (u >= -1 && u <= width && v >= -1 && v <= height) {
239                        labelArray[u + 1][v + 1] = label;
240                }
241        }
242        
243        protected void setLabel(PntInt p, int label) { // (u,v) are image coordinates
244                setLabel(p.x, p.y, label);
245        }
246

258        
259}
